file_content.text: There's nothing I like better than the sight of a dead pirate.
You just let Major Orpharya know when the job's done.
Bureaucracy. Why is it just when stuff starts getting done, it always comes down to bureaucracy?
Believe me, I know exactly how you feel.
It's always the same story.
Yeah? I always thought you Intelligence-types were supposed to be more efficient than us grunts.
The strong don't let bureaucracy stop them.
You're weak.
Easy for you to say.
In my experience, leadership structures like nothing better than to get in the way.
The people in charge are dumb.
They like giving orders, that's for sure.
I like the straightforward approach myself.
I hate bureaucracy.
Should've been a bounty hunter.
Excuse me?
Trouble from the higher-ups?
Don't like your orders?
I've spent the last three months cleaning every bit of worthless Republic-supporting pirate scum off this planet.
I've got one group left, led by Mad Raggo Tolin, and Major Orpharya calls the mission off. Says to pack up my blaster and come home.
Why would the Empire call the mission off?
There must be a good reason.
That would drive me nuts.
Stop complaining.
It isn't right to call off a mission, not when we're this close to completing it.
Major says it's too dangerous. Too many pirates. Not worth the risk. Risk, my eye.
Hey. Major says the mission's too dangerous for me, okay. Nothing says I can't ask someone to take out these pirates for me.
What are you thinking?
Sure. Why not?
I'm thinking you go in there, kill as many of those pirates as you can, and report back to my commanding officer.
Major Orpharya doesn't need to know about my involvement, and what she doesn't know won't hurt her.
Not interested. [Refuse quest]
Forget orders. These pirates are enemies of the Empire.
Pirates won't know what hit them.
